text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Sensitive Canadian document found on rainy streets
text.summary: On August 15, 2008, a classified Environment Canada document detailing security vulnerabilities of the NEMESIS database used by Canadian law enforcement to prosecute environmental law-breakers was found on the street in Kanata, Ontario, leading to controversy about how it wound up there and how classified it actually is.
text.summary2: After a classified Environment Canada document was found in an Ottawa street (the third recent document mismanagement incident), the Environment Minister and two spokespeople for Environment Canada downplayed the sensitivity of the document while reiterating the importance of document security, as Paul Dewar, an MP, questioned the Conservative government's document management.
